name: racial
content:

B2 based on someone's perceived race, especially in a way that is unfair or harmful; or based on policies, behaviours, rules, etc. that result in unfair or harmful treatment of people because of their perceived race: racial discrimination/prejudice The law has done little to prevent racial inequality. She accused another contestant of using a racial slur against her.
B2 happening between people of different races: He had a vision of a society living in racial harmony. We talk a lot about racial diversity and tolerance. At that time, racial tensions were rising, locally and throughout the country.
B2 relating to race or to someone's perceived race: They are members of a racial minority. Please state your name, age, marital status, and racial identity.
More examplesFewer examplesThey argue that the membership of the Council does not reflect the racial make-up of the city.The system of racial segregation that used to exist in South Africa was called apartheid.The racial killings at the weekend have triggered off a wave of protests throughout the country.
